instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1466: What is A1466? A1466 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2015, 2017, Mid 2012, Mid 2013, Early 2014 with EMC 2925, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00165, 820-3209, 820-3437..
definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1278: What is A1278? A1278 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook or Macbook Pro Unibody from years Late 2008, Mid 2009, Mid 2010, Early 2011, Late 2011, Mid 2012 with EMC 2254, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2327, 820-2530, 820-2879, 820-2936, 820-3115..

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> macbook air 13,  show battery in status bar, and no trackpad
threads.message:
no liquid damage

it had a shorted cap near the cpu, and a burnt fuse, fixed, works

needs new battery though it wont charge, tried with another battery it works, but i cannot check the show battery status in  menu bar, that shows up then right away goes away nad unchecks, and i want to change setting for the trackpad it says no trackpad but actually that works

after OSX reinstall its the same

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> macbook air 13,  show battery in status bar, and no trackpad
threads.message:
"it had a shorted cap near the cpu, and a burnt fuse, fixed, works"
Is better to contact a magician, he will surely know what components you changed and what board you have on the desk...

If you really think to receive usefull help with such information provided, I'm afraid you need to have lot of patience.

What happens if you measure <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G2H</SIGNAL> when battery gets unchecked?
Trackpad issue appears at the same time?

You must be the first interested to post usefull information, in order to get proper help...

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> macbook air 13,  show battery in status bar, and no trackpad
threads.message:
macbook air have a very typical issue, i fixed many of those with this problem , looks u havent got the chance to meet this issue yet...

<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board, one of the the buffering cap <CAPACITOR>C7377</CAPACITOR> burnt out, taking the G3H F7140 fuse out, very typical issue

i fixed those two, and now its in the aforementioned state, and i dont see water on the board

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> macbook air 13,  show battery in status bar, and no trackpad
threads.message: hmm, interesting, there is a wine damaged <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>, running 10.13, that is doing the same thing,m wont charge, and says the trackpad is not connected, but the trackpad actually works....
